snippet: Amid calls for a national miners’ strike, South Africa’s justice minister said the unrest would dent the country’s image and hurt its economy.
abstract: South African Justice Min Jeff Radebe warns protesters that the government will no longer tolerate violent demonstrations in mining areas, which have been going on for five weeks; says bloody unrest threatens to seriously dent the country's image as well as its economy.
lead_paragraph: Amid calls for a national miners’ strike, South Africa’s justice minister said the unrest would dent the country’s image and hurt its economy.

headline.seo: South African Leaders Warn Against Violent Protests
headline.main: South Africa Warns Against Violence as Protests Fester
headline.print_headline: South Africa Warns Against Violence as Protests Fester
